meanings.sent1: She is solvent and can easily repay the money she borrowed.
meanings.sent2: The financially solvent company had no trouble securing a loan.
meanings.sent3: Even the little girl's piggy bank was solvent enough to buy a new toy.
meanings.sent4: His prudent spending habits kept him solvent through tough times.
meanings.sent5: Being solvent is a great relief during financial uncertainty.

meanings.definition: A liquid substance capable of dissolving other substances
meanings.sent1: The chemist used a solvent to dissolve the solid compound.
meanings.sent2: Water is a common solvent used in many chemical reactions.
meanings.sent3: The spilled solvent created a colorful swirl on the laboratory floor.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a solvent, breaking down the barriers between them.
meanings.sent5: The powerful solvent quickly broke down the stubborn stain.
